Super good spot especially if you want to go to utrecht or amsterdam
I agree, very friendly people. We got a car very fast and the man was nice. He even borowed us his phone and took us exactly where we needed.
I just wait 5 min and it was not during the rush hours. Maybe i was lucky but it's true that people are very friendly there !
Got a ride really fast to Apeldoorn. Also got free cardboard from the hotel next to the road when I asked for it!
Hike within 0,5 seconds. Perfect spot to get into germany
2min at night :D
Best place in direction of Amsterdam
The road-side is not so wide, but it's a two line road and when not so much cars, possible to stop for the direction Muenster. It worked great in the evening!
Waited two minutes before getting picked up to Heerenveen
got ride to Harlingen within 20 min
Agree with other reviews. Got a ride within 20 min to Heerenveen.
Got a ride to Zwolle within 5 mins. Brilliant spot just behind traffic lights, drivers spot you quickly while they're still getting back to full speed. They can easily reach you at the bus stop.

Very good spot to hitch from, cars start from the traffic light from two directions and can see you easily because they don't drive too fast yet. Former official hitchhikers spot. Better than the petrol station down the road, because they usually don't like hitchhikers "bothering" the drivers.
Great spot, hitched here twice alway found a car to Antwerp/Belgium in half an hour

For the first time ever, an employee asked me (friendly) to ask a ride on the parking behind the gas station, because people would get uncomfortable. Well, I get uncomfortable of these shitty rules and people who believe all hitchhikers are murderers and rapists. The first car I asked drove me to Antwerp.
hithchiked directly to paris from here (a few times). Many dutch lease cars fill up their gas here because they are not allowed to get gas for free outside holland.
Saw an English car outside the McDonald's. Waited for them to return to car and they took me to Dunkerque for the ferry.
Got a ride (for 2 people) straight into Antwerp city centre within 10 mins. Huge petrol station, toilets and food etc. also available.
use it often for Zwolle, good spot but sometimes the staff is anoyed by HH. just do your thing and send love :)

It seems to depend whether gas station personnel sends you away or not. I was once told to stand behind the gas station, but other times it was no problem standing in front of it. Either way, a good place to catch a ride to at least the first gas station on the A1 towards Germany.
Pretty good place to go east. I was here in the dark on an early Monday morning in January (during rush hour) and didn't get sent away. Found a ride to Osnabrück in about 20-30 minutes.

I have a different experience: Lots of people going east towards Hengelo/Germany. Not so many heading north, but still very doable to find somebody in that direction, even late at night. No problems with employees for me.

Very good for directions North. Directions west and east are more difficult.
Shell gas station with personal saying you can't hitch from the gas station "Shell regulations" and rather have to stand somewhere else. I would suggest first (making trouble) and continue anyway, if they really start to threat then stand right at the entrance (or at the exit) of this P- place.

N337 towards Zwolle. There's not that much place for cars to stop, but traffic is slow because of the roundabout and you're really well visable. Perfect spot to get out of Deventer northwards. If your destination is beyond Zwolle, consider refusing short rides because the main road through Zwolle is quite hard to hitchhike from.

Lots of people were offering rides to various parts of Ams, but we had time and decided to wait for someone going into center of Amsterdam. In the end we got amazing ride in a beautiful oldschool car of some guy living in the center of Amsterdam.
Chatted to people at petrol station. Not much traffic but got lucky and got lift all the way to Dusseldorf.
Nice spot. We even recycled some pretty decent food from the restaurant on the bridge
After asking a few (approx. 10) drivers for a ride, we got one within 15 minutes

Excellent place to get out if you do not want to go into Amsterdam but rather towards the east. Try to get a ride at least to the A1, which is the main road that ends up going to the east. Once you are on the A'dam Ring, it can be hard to find such a ride. Also a good spot to go into A'dam ofcourse.
Nice spot. A lot of place And good way to go to Amsterdam/Utrecht

Good spot for Utrecht.
I was waiting here for 10 minutes.

I always use this when I leave Delft direction R'dam(south)
very nice spot even on Sunday
Roadworks atm (end of feb 2013), but still a decent spot anyway on weekdays.
not very good on weekends: most traffic comes from the University area and that isn't very crowded then

Ramp to the A28 direction Amersfoort, with traffic lights. This is the main exit road from the big Uithof university area, and is a perfect spot for mainly afternoon weekday traffic. Avg waiting time during the week: 20 minutes. And over 1,5 hours on sunday. Don't do that. 
 
Getting there: Take bus 11 to the final stop: WKZ (Wilhelmina Kinderziekenhuis), walk along the in the direction of the A28 (you'll see it), and along the hospital towards the traffic lights.

The bus from Enschede gets you here in 15 min for 4,5euro. 
I got the ride just to Rheine.
Lot of Polish trucks in the morning, one of them took me to Hannover (on his way to Croatia).
90% of traffic for Bad Bentheim or Nordhorn, best bet to hitch over the border and get out at second on-ramp in Germany.
Germany. A1 access lane 33. Bus 60/62 stop Hanzepoort, 400 m N Enschedesestraat. 	Hard shoulder on sliproad.
The fifth car took me to Harlingen. I think you don't have to wait long for a ride to Amsterdam, either.
Harlingen, (Amsterdam). N383 Europaplein. Bus 1/70/71/97 stop â€œEuropapleinâ€, 200 m W Harlingerstraatweg/Europaplein	. Fuel station, Ws traffic square.

Getting a lift from the point took us 3 min. Perfect place wit a bus line allowing driver to stop. 100 m further there are trafic lights for those who don't feel like standing and hitching. 
There is little tankstation right after the roundabout which can be a shelter when it rains.
Not very crowded on a monday morning at 9. Asked around for an hour (~25 cars) until we found someone taking us all the way to Strassbourg.
10min for Dunkerque :)

Decent croweded gasstation. Standing at the end of the parkway, waited ~7 minutes for Gent. 
Perfect for Antwerpen, Brussels, Gent and probably further like Paris

Sit on the south side of the building to catch the longway-drivers. We waited for about 30 minutes in the pleasant sunlight (and there are free bathrooms!) until a very pleasant driver approached us and took us all the way to Gent.

Now my preferred on-ramp eastbound from Deventer :)
On-ramp 24 Deventer-Oost, A1 towards Hengelo/Enschede/Germany. Recently reconstructed, but seems to be good.
got a ride to The Hague in 8 minutes on a saturday morning
This gasstation is very large and busy and you can very easily find rides to Rotterdam, The Hague and Leiden. Even late at night it is easy here.
Getting here from Vliegveldstraat (N737): leave the viaduct on the SE side, down to the highway, and under the bridge. The grass is quite wide so it should be safe.
Best spot to get over the fence

Arrived here little before 8pm, it was almost no traffic. We managed to ask to 30 cars and not even one pretended to go direction Amsterdam. After 10pm the shop is closing and traffic is minimal. We still tried until 11pm, before going camping here. In the morning a lot of traffic and we got a direct ride to AMsterdam in 10 minutes, second car we asked. Really contrasting experiences
lots of cars, got a lift to Amsterdam in 5 minutes, including an introduction to the former mayor of Almere at his house :-)
Petrol station Aalscholver

nice place to catch someone.
i have to stay on this place with me friend ( we go to the france) and we stayed about 10 minutes.

2 years later i stayed here for 40 minutes. The traffic is very high, and the guy took me to the parking place nearby the Amsterdam.
got a lift here within 5 minutes! I waited next to the left turn traffic lights (which go onto the a12. From there I got to germany in about 5 hours!
Good spot to hitch to Amsterdam. This is my usual spot after school. I hitchhike from here quite often and I usually wait less than 10 minutes.
I suggest asking for rides at the exit barriers of the airport parking area. Driver stops at barrier, opens window, you ask "hey, are you driving direction...". Good luck!
Lots of traffic to any direction.
Nice place to start hitchhiking anywhere if you arrived at Eindhoven airport. Traffic is going from the airport and the industrial area. Cars can stop on the hardly used bicycle lane.
Perfect spot to Leuuwarden: Got my shortest waiting time ever here: 3 SECONDS!!  ;-)
A lot of traffic towards Leeuwarden. If you're heading north just let the cars to Leeuwarden go. Usually once every three minutes a car stops.

Direction: Leeuwarden (NW) or Burgum, Dokkum (N)
Hard shoulder on sliproad, clearly visible
Wait at traffic lights for lift to Amsterdam.
Very good for direction Groningen, if you're just coming from there and want to travel direction Heerenveen you need to have some more patience. In the end it will work too though!
Even some nice lights where you can stand under when it's dark :)
Stand just after the roundabout,  you're clearly visible. There is a hard shoulder where cars can stop. Good spot to Groningen (a lot of traffic between Drachten and Groningen)
Very good spot, busstop helps cars to stop savely
Very good spot with save place to stop
So quick, great spot
Good spot, lots of traffic, sign recommend but doable by thumb as well
Nice spot for getting a ride to Arnhem and further with huge space where even trucks can (and will) stop.
Ride to Amsterdam, 4 minutes, thumb
Good spot, hirched by thumb got a ride to Rotterdam. May also be good gor going towards Barnevels
easy
Service station Palmpol, A1 direction Apeldoorn / Germany.
Arrived there around 10pm and got really lucky; first person I asked was going to Groningen. Seems like a very solid spot.

Gas station on A50, good if you wan to go to Kampen, Zwolle or further to the north. 
Accessible from the village Heerde if you cross the small ditch south of the bridge over the highway
The very first car pulled over, but the driver was going to the wrong part of Assen. Waited 2 more minutes for someone else to take me to the centre.
On-ramp Rolde on the N33 towards Assen-zuid. There's a bus stop here so lots of space for cars to pull over.
Great spot towards Groningen, never had to wait for more than 5 minutes (even in the evening).
On-ramp Assen Noord, A28 direction Groningen. Traffic from straight ahead is quite fast, but there's a nice shoulder where they can stop. Seems like less traffic than at Assen-West.

ESSO! Petrol in the Eye of the Tiger!

Petrol station Bosserhof (new location since 2009 or so).

Got a ride quickly towards Gouda.

About 200 metres before the ramp to the highway towards Amsterdam (A12, exit 17 Westraven) there are traffic lights. Cars stop here anyway :) I found this a much better (and safer) spot than near the ramp itself where cars already accelerate.

I was here during a world championship footbal match so there wasn't too much traffic. Still I got picked up within 20 minutes or so by a very friendly lady.

This location is next to tram stop Kanaleneiland Zuid (line 60 to Nieuwegein Zuid or 61 to IJssel
Good place for catching the car to Zwolle.I catch the car within a minute.

Good spot for Zwartsluis and Zwolle.
Bus station and a lot of place for drivers to stop.

Good spot for catching the boat.

You can hitch the boat!
Perfecte plek om de A28 op te liften! Auto's kunnen gemakkelijk stoppen bij de bushalte.
Waited only 4 min just spoke to the driver and he took me to groeningen , i wass heading to hamburg !
Great spot going to Zwolle (20km) or further. Lot's of space to pull over. Even worked in the dark!
You can literally hitchhike from any spot in the island. Every place works smoothly and quickly!

One of the best places in Utrecht for going northeast (A28). Got a ride to Amersfoort or Zwolle within 10 minutes countless times on this spot. Just ask drivers nicely - staff are friendly and let's keep it that way.
Shell petrol station on street going towards A27. Most cars going northeast (A28, Amersfoort, Zwolle) but also south (A27, Nieuwegein)
Cars can not stop here very easily...

Good hitchhiking spot to go to directions Venlo, Maastricht, Duisburg, Düsseldorf, Köln... I waited only 10 minutes on a calm morning... You can get here by bus, with several lines (exit De Doekenborg or Van Boetbergweg/Aldenhof)
Petrol station where people go before hitting the highway. Perfect spot to get to the south. There is a carpooling spot just opposite of the station.
Good spot for Amersfoort/Amsterdam/Utrecht. Plenty of place to stop.
Although not a petrol station, it's a good place to hitch, as people stop here to go to the restaurants on the other side. Perhaps busier in summer than in winter. Took me half an hour.

Very good place to find a long-distance ride to Germany. I was staying here for half and hour and I found a directly to Hanover. I saw a lot of German cars resting on the parking behind the gas station.
Esso gas station, very good spot to go north towards Amsterdam.
I got her by bike from home, but i think bus 37 comes close. It seems to far to walk from the center though...
Big service station in direction to amsterdam. might take you a while to get there. i think i walked a half hour from trainstation delft zuid to get here, but it was worth it
We was leaving Amsterdam and at this point we founded a car almost to Apeldorn. Many cars. But it take 20 min to get here from Weesp
There is a bus stop. A lot of traffic. It's easy to find a car in Amsterdam direction.

On-ramp for the N31 direction Heerenveen, Zwolle and (Harlingen).

Sharp turn, so traffic is slow and next to that there's a nice shoulder for people to stop. Using a sign might help but most traffic is for direction Zwolle anyway.
in Monchengladbach direction
to Venlo in 5 minutes
at morning I got lift to Venray in 5 minutes
Hitched a ride to Zwolle in about 15 mins!
Direction Zwolle-Groningen/Leeuwarden
On-ramp towards the highway. Good spot if you don't feel like walking the 1,5km.
Ask people in the carpark, second car I asked went straight to my destination (Middelburg). Best place I've encountered so far!
Petrol station Wouwse Tol Noord. A58 towards Bergen op Zoom / Middelburg (/ Antwerpen)
Good spot for  Eindhoven, cars don´t drive very fast and there is a good place for them to stop. I waited 15min.
N785 direction A12 (highway). Just behind the roundabout works well. but a little down the road at the bus stop is good too :)
Direction Scharwoude/A7.

A few hundred meters after the Tilburg sign, there is a parking spot on the side of the road great for going to Breda (and from there to go both to Belgium and to Rotterdam/Den Haag/Amsterdam). After 5 minutes a man gave me a lift to Breda!
Ride to near Amsterdam in 5min, in rush hour.
On-ramp 29 Drachten-West, direction Heerenveen. You have to walk along the roadside for a bit to get here, but then it's a perfect place to hitch from. Nice hard shoulder.

Took me less than 15 mins after I put my thumb up and put the sign "A-dam"
Verry good spot!

Long hard shoulder, hitchhikers are well seen from a distance, I was picked up by a truck driver directly to Amsterdam. Waiting time: 10 minutes (if you have time, just use this route, because it is much more scenic, the dyke is worth it).
Got a ride almost instantly to Breda with sign, quite a bit of traffic.
Petrol station Wouwse Tol Zuid, A58 towards Roosendaal / Breda (/ Rotterdam)

Great spot to get to Amsterdam or to the A2. Onramp has lots of traffic and big emergency lane for people to pull over. Were there for 3 minutes when a woman spontaneously stopped and took us to the intersection with A2, where she dropped us off on the first exit in the direction east, tocontinue to Amsterdam.
Get here taking bus number 5 from Ede centre and getting off just after you pass the freeway. Bus 85 could work too but longer walk.
used to get from Dokkum to Groningen. was picked up within 5 minutes. small road with mostly local traffic so you may need multiple rides to get to Groningen. lots of place for car to stop

On-ramp Kampen on N50, direction Zwolle/Amersfoort/Apeldoorn.

Awesome. Hard. Shoulder.
at the bus stop, great for rides to wageningen.
Bus stop on Hollewandsweg, towards N337/Wijhe/Deventer.
R103 towards Ommen. Touristic route, but still quite some people using this road to get to Ommen (and further).
N35, direction Raalte/Zwolle. There's a bus bay/hard shoulder here. Even though it's just before Nijverdal, there's enough long distance traffic here passing through, so no need to walk further west.
Me and my friend (heading to Amsterdam that time), we were standing at the lights just for a few minutes, The thing is, you have to be ready to just jump to the car while there is still red light on.
Cars have to stop at the traffic lights or are comming out of Wassenaar. Therefore they're not fast and there's plenty of space to stop. Really good to get towards Leiden and a lot further :)

Great busy spot. Me and a german friend waited for a ride here, I went hitching towards zwolle and further north and she went towards hengelo and further to germany, I got picked up within 5 minutes and she got picked up soon afterwards
Direct ride to Deventer in 15min during rush hour.
Bus stop in Raalte on the N348 towards Deventer. Nice spot.
Slow traffic because of the turns. Pretty much all of it goes to Holten. Road is closed at night because it passes through the National Park.
Enough space on the hard shoulder for cars to stop.

If you're leaving Heeg this a good place to stop, all trafic leaving the village passes through here, and there is enough space to stop. 
From the centre you'll walk toward de Hommerts and you stop in Osingahuizen before the bridge. 
In summer and weekends it's also possible to get a lift straight to Utrecht or Amsterdam as many tourists are passing through.
fast place, easy to go to utrecht !
Direction: Utrecht, Amsterdam, Den Haag
Perfect hitchhiking spot for the center of Nijmegen or Radboud university/hospital. I use it every wednesday!
great towards Aachen. worked two times
Aachen	N281 x Nieuw Eyckholt. 50 m W Stationstraat, 200 m SW Geerstraat, 100 m W, 450 m SW Looierstraat ][ N281	. Hard shoulder on sliproad
On-ramp 3 Oosterhesselen on A37 towards Hoogeveen. More traffic than expected. Very slow traffic because of the roundabout.
N371 towards Dieverbrug. Spot at the petrol station just after the roundabout.
Bus stop (hard shoulder) on the N35 towards Zwolle. Cars going straight might be a bit fast, but those from the N348 are just accelerating. Perfect spot!
Good spot after the boat from Schiermonnikoog arrives. Got a lift to Amsterdam in 10 minutes. You can just stay near the exit from both parking places on the line for buses.
Huge petrol station with big and quite luxurious restaurant. A lot of people heading to Groningen is stopping here just for coffe or lunch/snack.
Petrol station Texaco. Not a big one, but fair traffic in the northern direction.
On-ramp Drachten-west, A7 direction Groningen. Hard to walk here, but if you get dropped off at this spot it's great for going east :)
Heerenveen (11), A32 in direction Leeuwarden, (Groningen), (Joure). Shoulder for cars to stop.
Bus stop just before the big roundabout in Joure. Lots of traffic and perfect place for cars to stop. Use a sign and you'll be fine! :D
Got a ride straight to Ghent, BE in about 5 minutes. Got dropped of there by some guys who said they always used this spot when leaving delft.

This gas station is an excellent start when you're hitching from Delft. It is accessible from 'de Rotterdamse weg' walking from the parking lot in the direction of the highway through the park. There is a small wooden bridge across the ditch, just behind the Burger King as seen from the highway.
Crossing Kapperallee/N346. If you're continuing towards Deventer coming from Lochem/Vorden, consider this spot. Especially during rush hour all the traffic takes the 'short cut' through Eefde.
Roundabout on the N344 towards Apeldoorn. The perfect spot to get a ride going to Apeldoorn.
Exit 34 Leek/Roden, A7 direction Groningen. Bus stop at the on-ramp to the highway. Quite a lot of traffic so a very good spot for Groningen, but further around the city might be harder.
Bus stop at the roundabout, stand here to hitch into the city.

resting place and gas station on A28 
direction Zwolle, Groningen ...
the whole iland is very easy to hitchhike
easy to go to some of the small vilages like dreischor noordgouwen etc.

gas station and resting point on A16 direction Rotterdam, Delft, De Haag 
Accessible from outside the highway, too.
Good place to go to Terneuzen and beyond (Belgium). Just stand at the very right, there is a bus stop.

On-ramp 12 Reeuwijk, A12 direction Rotterdam/Den Haag. During rush hour it might be even better than petrol station Bodegraven (exit before this one). Nice hard shoulder just behind roundabout. Sign recommended.
Hard shoulder. Traffic going to the west in the direction of the recreation area of Egmond aan Zee

I hitch-hiked in the dark, asking at windows. Nobody wound down the window, unti one guy pulled over to the section in the middle of the road. Then immediately got a lift. Petrol station also seems ideal, but didn't give it a try.

Traffic Lights heading south. Zierekzee, Steenbergen.
There's a fuel station visible maybe 150 metres away. (texaco). Place in the middle of road for cars to pull over if they wish to as well.
Hard shoulder on the N855 towards Frederiksoord / Vledder / Diever.
Got picked up the instance i was dropped there,
Roundabout at the intersection of the N314 and N319. Good for rides east towards Vorden, as well as west to Zutphen/Eefde/Deventer, north to Lochem and south towards Doetinchem/Arnhem.
N766 (Raalterweg) towards Raalte, Ommen. Hitch just behind the traffic lights, cars have lots of space to stop.
The end of the exit is very good to get a lift to the center of Utrecht. Talk with the drivers, there is a lot of space to walk here.
Maastricht / Heerlen.

One and only very best hitchhiking spot from Bemelen to Maastricht. 

80% of drivers gets at or near the football stadium, from where you can hitchhike towards Eindhoven or Heerlen.

20% of the drivers passes the Oranjeplein in Maastricht. From there it is 10 minutes on foot to the Europaplein-junction, the best spot to hitchhike to Liege. 

Expected waiting time here in Bemelen is <5 minutes between 7.30 and 09.00 AM, 5-10 minutes the rest of the day, and 15-30 minutes on Sunday morning.

Great spot to get to Utrecht! Don't bother walking all the way to the highway, just stay put and keep your sign up! I hitched here more than 30 times, my average waiting time is 10 mins. Just an awesome spot :)

Good spot just south of the crossing with traffic lights, hard shoulder (old bus  stop) so cars have space to stop.
A lot of traffic in the direction of Drachten (15 km S) which has good hitchhiking spots for the A7 towards Groningen (E) and probably also towards Heerenveen and Joure (SW)
Direction of Den Haag, very busy, wait at the traffic light, on the ramp enough space for cars to stop!!

If you are going to Germany (Aachen
) it is better to be dropped off here that at big Kreuz. People from cities around are usually going to Germany. (also good spot for Maastrich)
Might be because of sheer coincidence, but after switching from Overijsselseweg we had a car within 5 minutes straight to Groningen, after 30-35min wait at Overijsselseweg.

Bus stop on the ring towards the Drachtsterweg for Groningen / Drachten. Cars coming from the center pass here to exit the city. good spot because cars can stop easily at the bus stop and continue effortlessly on the Aldlansdyk.
Highway service station "'t Haasje" on the A2/E25 towards Maastricht and Aachen (D). The service station on the other side of the highway is called "Groote Bleek"
A32 towards Meppel, Zwolle. Weird on-ramp but because of that a perfect spot to hitchhike with plenty of space for cars to stop.
A32 towards Heerenveen, Leeuwarden. Really slow traffic because of the newly constructed roundabout. Hard shoulder gives cars a good possibility to stop.
N334 towards Steenwijk. Great spot at a bus stop just after the roundabout. The route to Steenwijk goes through a pretty scenic area, worth checking out!

Direction Drachten and Groningen (N31/A7). This is one of the main roads leading out of Leeuwarden towards these cities. Go stand where the bus lane starts as cars have a good chance to stop there for you. The bus stop further down the road is less than ideal since cars for Groningen are in the middle lane and can't easily turn over to the right anymore. To get to this spot you can walk or take a bus (14/28/94/95) to Drachten and get out at that bus stop (Drachtsterweg).
Almost no waiting time during rush hour for Amsterdam/ Utrecht (via gas station on A9 at Amstelveen if necessary). Can take a bit longer outside rush hour, but still very good.
Amsterdam, Amstelveen, Utrecht, (Amersfoort). A200 x Camera Obscuraweg. 	Train station â€œHaarlem Spaarnwoudeâ€, 100 m S pedestrian bridge over A200, 30 m N	. Bus stop at the begin of the motorway.
Service station Neerduist, excellent to get a ride to Amsterdam! Nothing more to say :-)

All cars can take A2 and A27 from this point.

Usually take 10 mins to get a ride tot the south
Maastricht. Start A79 near N281 x Welterlaan 50 m W Stationstraat, 500 m SW/SE Geerstraat, 700 m SW Valkenburgerweg, 300 m SE Pijnsweg. Fuel station at the begin of the motorway. Ns.

Den Haag, Rotterdam.	A4 access lane 6a	. Train station Leiden-Lammerschans, 350 m SE Melchior Treublaan, 50 m SE Kanaalbrug, 600 m SE Heinekenpad, 250 m S Willen van der Madeweg. Hard shoulder on sliproad
Your way to Amsterdam. It is a common spot.

I used this place twice going south. I had a sign for Rotterdam and got picked up within 5min. both of the times, but you could try further, especially during rush-hour. Alternatively you could ask the driver to drop you at the gasstation a few km down the highway, this'll save you the walk at least:)

We came from Leeuwrden and got off at the exit. there is a bus bay and line. in case U have a badluck tthere is a bus station ribgt behind :) getting a lift to Den Helder on saturdays afternoonn took us 7 min.
while hitching I observed that there was quite a lot traffic from the oposite direction (N99 entering the A7 motorway direction Amsterdam and the entrance way looked decent for hitchers
Large Busstop on Westroijensestraat. Best spot for Nijmegen/Arnhem.
Big service station 15 kilometers before the 'afsluitdijk', the main road to Leeuwarden/ Groningen and further to Bremen & Hamburg.
To Turnhout. Bridge N261/A58. Hard shoulder on the bridge.
Esso garage.  Great spot.  Short bus ride or walkable from the centre.
Fuel station 't Hoekske. Lots of traffic direction Rotterdam. Short wait.
Direction: Arnhem, Deventer, Germany. Very suitable entrance ramp

For [b]Tubbergen. N349/N746[/b]. I hitch here twice a week on average, usually well after dark, and have always been away within 20 minutes. Take bus 23 to Canisiuscollege, and make sure you have a sign.
N746 by Schaepmanmonument. Excellent for Almelo, always need to carry sign to get beyond Almelo though.
Pretty good spot for hitching towards the highway/service station there and/or towards Oldenzaal or Hengelo. Mostly a lot of traffic.
Traffic lights and more than enough place for cars to stop on entrance lane to the North. Not too many cars come by but more than enough :)
Always a good place towards Hengelo. Waiting time during evening (dark) most times 10-60 min.
Stood next to the traffic light going to Liege, got picked up very quickly. If you’re going south you could make a sign for both Aachen and Liege
It was under 15 minutes, got picked by a young couple who took us to a train station on their way. Our first stop, to reach bremen(through zwolle)
Just asked the ppl on the gas station
Was wrting a sign to use at the onramp, but a man saw me writing it and offered me a ride.
